intro: Carum alpinum subsp. corydalinum, commonly known as alpine caraway, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small white or yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, oval seeds that are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold climates. Its botanical features make it an important species in alpine ecosystems.
